page.title: 03DARTMOUTH NAVAL COLLEGE
page.content: The main building of the{Britannia {Royal Naval College}was completed in 1905. It replaced the two wooden training ships which were in Dartmouth Harbour:{Britannia}(after which the College was named) and Hindostan.These had been used to train the Naval officers for the preceding 42 years. The College provides the initial training of all Naval officers when they first join. It{employs}about{320}all told including 30 lecturing staff, about 40"office staff" and about 250 "support staff" such as gardeners, cooks, stewards, shipwrights, engineers and boat crews. Many of the College facilities including its theatre,{"The Casper {John Hall"}and sporting facilities are made available to the community of Dartmouth.
